tag: html body text center div table tbody tr td table tbody tr td h1 span
html body text center div table tbody tr td table tbody tr td table tbody tr td span
content: Designed by Sir Thomas Bouch, the Tay Railway Bridge was opened in 1878.

tag: html body text center div table tbody tr td table tbody tr td table tbody tr td p span
content: The single-track bridge was a box construction with numerous box-section legs, up to 230ft apart, supporting the steam trains up to 88ft in the air as they snaked for almost two miles over the Tay and Perth-bound shipping. Bouch had not designed his structure with the estuary winds considered in his calculations, nor had the contractor been supervised to prevent his use of badly manufactured material.

tag: html body text center div table tbody tr td table tbody tr td table tbody tr td p span
content: These points were discovered after the bridge’s central sections failed during the stormy night of 28 December 1879 while a train was crossing. The train, with seventy five passengers and crew, poured off the collapsing bridge into the icy river with all lives lost.

tag: html body text center div table tbody tr td table tbody tr td table tbody tr td p span
content: Bouch, who was held entirely responsible, could not take the strain either and died shortly after the inquiry. When travelling on the 1887 replacement bridge over the Tay, the bases of the original’s supporting legs can be seen along the eastern side, reaching out of the cold water, a disturbing sight on a stormy crossing.

tag: html body text center div table tbody tr td table tbody tr td table tbody tr td p span
content: William McGonagall remembers the night of the 28th well in his famous poem ‘Railway Bridge of the Silvery Tay’.

tag: html body text center div table tbody tr td table tbody tr td table tbody tr td table tbody tr td table tbody tr td p strong span
html body text center div table tbody tr td table tbody tr td table tbody tr td table tbody tr td table tbody tr td p span
content: Narrated Scottish History Boxed Set. Around 3.5 hours of Narration, the history of Scotland told in an entertaining, informative and amusing style. A comprehensive guide to Scotland's rich history.

html body text center div table tbody tr td table tbody tr td table tbody tr td table tbody tr td table tbody tr td strong span
content: Story of a Nation - by P. Hume Brown

tag: html body text center div table tbody tr td table tbody tr td table tbody tr td table tbody tr td table tbody tr td span
content: For many decades Hume Brown's work has stood the test as one of the most authoritative histories of Scotland. The text includes illustrations, maps, a list of events, of sovereigns and genealogical tables and is fully indexed.
